bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Anne Gilchrist, 15 March 1885

Walt Whitman Collection, 1842–1957, Rare Book & Manuscript Library, University of Pennsylvania

revisionDesc.change: added images for letter and additional orgName; checked, corrected

body.p: In a letter from John Burroughs a while since he writes me that your article is to appear in To-Day—When printed I wish Herby w'dwould get ten copies & send me by mail, (in two packages, five in each)—Nothing very different with me—I am full as well as common—a new & good care-taker for me here in the house, the old ones gone, Mrs. Davis, a sailor's widow, young & strong & good-natured, & very kind & attentive—according to indications a blessed change—I am writing a little—Shall probably add to next edition of L of G. at end not more than 30 or 35 pages

p.hi: After-Songs and A Letter of Parting

body.p: the "letter" prose a sort of résumé & talk in general—The old bulk part of the book left all the same as now. I am writing this Sunday afternoon up in my room by wood fire. I suppose you rec'dreceived the Camden Post.
